name: Baker Beach
address:
1504 Pershing Dr
San Francisco, CA, USA 94129
about: Baker Beach is a public beach on the peninsula of San Francisco with stunning views of the Golden Gate Bridge.
notesFromOthers: Great spot for photos of the Golden Gate Bridge!
Battery Chamberlin trail gives amazing panoramic views

name: Dolores Park
address:
Dolores St & 19th St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94114
about: Dolores Park is a local favorite park with a wide open grassy area perfect for dog owners and dog watching.
notesFromOthers: The off-leash area is so fun to watch! Bring your pup
20th & Church St corner has the best sunset skyline views

name: Pier 39
address:
Beach St & The Embarcadero
San Francisco, CA, USA 94133
about: Pier 39 is a popular waterfront marketplace with restaurants, shops, and sea lion viewing. Famous for its resident sea lions, street performers, and stunning bay views.
notesFromOthers: The sea lions are absolutely adorable - must see!
Amazing views of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge

name: Ferry Building
address:
1 Ferry Building
San Francisco, CA, USA 94111
about: The Ferry Building is a historic terminal and marketplace featuring artisan food vendors, restaurants, and a farmers market. An iconic landmark with a beautiful clock tower overlooking the bay.
notesFromOthers: Saturday farmers market is incredible - best produce!
Blue Bottle Coffee inside is perfect for a bay view
The architecture and clock tower are stunning

name: Oracle Park
address:
24 Willie Mays Plaza
San Francisco, CA, USA 94107
about: Oracle Park is home to the San Francisco Giants and one of baseball's most beautiful ballparks. Stunning views of the bay, iconic right field wall, and the famous splash hits into McCovey Cove.
notesFromOthers: Even non-baseball fans love this place!
Get garlic fries - they're legendary
Walking around outside on game days is free and fun

name: Twin Peaks
address:
501 Twin Peaks Blvd
San Francisco, CA, USA 94114
about: Twin Peaks offers 360-degree panoramic views of San Francisco from 922 feet elevation. One of the highest points in the city with breathtaking vistas of downtown, the bay, and beyond.
notesFromOthers: Best sunrise/sunset spot in SF - absolutely stunning
Bring layers - it's always windy and cold up here!
Clear days you can see all the way to the East Bay

name: Japantown
address:
1610 Geary Blvd
San Francisco, CA, USA 94115
about: San Francisco's Japantown is one of the oldest Japanese communities in the US. Explore the Peace Plaza, Japan Center with authentic restaurants and shops, and beautiful cultural architecture.
notesFromOthers: Amazing ramen and Japanese curry here!
Kinokuniya bookstore is a must-visit
Cherry blossom season in spring is magical

name: Powell-Hyde Cable Car
address:
Powell St & Market St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94102
about: The Powell-Hyde cable car line is one of San Francisco's most scenic routes, climbing steep hills with stunning views of the bay, Alcatraz, and winding down to Fisherman's Wharf.
notesFromOthers: Ride the outside running board for the full experience!
The view coming down Hyde Street is incredible
Get there early - lines get super long

name: Palace of Fine Arts
address:
3601 Lyon St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94123
about: A stunning Greco-Roman architectural monument built for the 1915 Panama-Pacific Exposition. The rotunda and colonnades surrounding a tranquil lagoon create a fairy-tale setting perfect for photos.
notesFromOthers: Feels like you're in ancient Greece!
Sunset photography here is unbeatable
Great for picnics by the lagoon

name: Painted Ladies
address:
710-720 Steiner St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94117
about: The iconic row of Victorian houses at Alamo Square, famous from Full House and countless postcards. These colorful 'Painted Ladies' with the SF skyline backdrop define classic San Francisco.
notesFromOthers: The Full House houses! Perfect photo op
Alamo Square park is great for picnics
Golden hour light makes them glow beautifully

name: Golden Gate Viewpoint
address:
Old Conzelman Rd
Mill Valley, CA, USA 94941
about: Experience the Golden Gate Bridge up close from the Marin Headlands side. Drive across the bridge and wind up the mountains for breathtaking views of the bridge, bay, and city skyline from elevated vantage points.
notesFromOthers: Worth the drive - totally different perspective!
The winding road up is an adventure itself
Best sunset views of the Golden Gate Bridge anywhere

name: Equator Coffee
address:
986 Lombard St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94133
about: Equator Coffee is a specialty coffee roaster known for its commitment to sustainability and direct relationships with coffee farmers.
notesFromOthers: Their single-origin pour-over is phenomenal!
Perfect pit stop before heading to the Golden Gate Bridge

name: The Coffee Movement
address:
1399 9th Ave
San Francisco, CA, USA 94122
about: The Coffee Movement in the Inner Sunset is a neighborhood favorite serving carefully sourced and expertly roasted coffee.
notesFromOthers: The oat milk latte with house blend is *chef's kiss*
Golden Gate Park is just 2 blocks away - perfect combo

name: Andytown Coffee Roasters
address:
3655 Lawton St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94122
about: Andytown Coffee Roasters near Ocean Beach is famous for its Snowy Plover affogato with house-made whipped cream.
notesFromOthers: Snowy Plover is a MUST - best affogato in the city
Take it to Ocean Beach 2 blocks away for the vibes

name: Neighbor Bakehouse
address:
2343 3rd St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94107
about: Neighbor Bakehouse combines excellent coffee with fresh-baked pastries in the Dogpatch neighborhood.
notesFromOthers: Butter croissant is perfection - get there early!
Walk it off at the Dogpatch waterfront nearby

name: The Mill
address:
736 Divisadero St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94117
about: The Mill on Divisadero is famous for its Four Barrel coffee and house-made toast with various toppings.
notesFromOthers: Avocado toast on Josey Baker bread is legendary
Alamo Square & Painted Ladies are walking distance!

name: Saint Frank Coffee
address:
2340 Polk St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94109
about: Saint Frank Coffee in Russian Hill is a bright, minimalist caf√© serving meticulously sourced coffee.
notesFromOthers: Their rotating single-origin espresso is incredible
Staff are super knowledgeable about their sourcing

name: Sightglass Coffee
address:
270 7th St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94103
about: Sightglass Coffee in SoMa is housed in a spacious former warehouse where they roast their own beans on-site.
notesFromOthers: Watching them roast through the windows is so cool
Espresso tonic on a sunny day = perfection

name: Four Barrel Coffee
address:
375 Valencia St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94103
about: Four Barrel Coffee in the Mission District is a beloved SF roaster known for its commitment to quality and direct trade.
notesFromOthers: Classic drip coffee showcases their roasting mastery
Mission murals nearby are absolutely worth seeing

name: Pinhole Coffee
address:
231 Fillmore St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94117
about: Pinhole Coffee in the Lower Haight offers a cozy, intimate space for enjoying specialty coffee.
notesFromOthers: Flat white here is meticulously crafted - so smooth
Vintage shops on Haight are great for browsing after

name: Ballast Coffee
address:
798 Florida St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94110
about: Ballast Coffee in the Mission serves thoughtfully sourced coffee in a minimalist, industrial-chic space.
notesFromOthers: Great vibe for working remotely - good wifi!
Tartine Bakery is nearby for pastries ü•ê

name: Japanese Tea Garden
address:
75 Hagiwara Tea Garden Dr
San Francisco, CA, USA 94118
about: The oldest public Japanese garden in the United States, featuring pagodas, koi ponds, stone lanterns, and a traditional tea house where you can enjoy tea and fortune cookies.
notesFromOthers: Visit early morning for peaceful moments before crowds
The drum bridge and moon bridge are stunning photo spots
Fortune cookies were invented here!

name: Three Gems by James Turrell
address:
50 Hagiwara Tea Garden Dr
San Francisco, CA, USA 94118
about: A hidden skyspace installation by artist James Turrell inside the de Young Museum. This meditative chamber uses light and sky to create a transcendent viewing experience.
notesFromOthers: Most people miss this - it's tucked in the museum!
Best at sunrise or sunset when the sky colors shift
Lie down and watch the sky transform - it's magical

name: Portals of the Past
address:
John F. Kennedy Dr & 6th Ave
San Francisco, CA, USA 94118
about: Mysterious marble columns standing alone at Lloyd Lake, remnants of a Nob Hill mansion's entrance destroyed in the 1906 earthquake and fire. A haunting memorial to San Francisco's history.
notesFromOthers: So eerie and beautiful - feels like ancient ruins
Perfect golden hour photography spot
The reflection in Lloyd Lake is incredible

name: Conservatory of Flowers
address:
100 John F. Kennedy Dr
San Francisco, CA, USA 94118
about: A stunning Victorian greenhouse and the oldest building in Golden Gate Park. Houses rare tropical plants, carnivorous specimens, and rotating special exhibitions in a beautifully restored glass palace.
notesFromOthers: The building itself is a work of art!
So humid inside - like stepping into a rainforest
Night lights during holidays are absolutely magical

name: Bison Paddock
address:
John F. Kennedy Dr & Chain of Lakes Dr
San Francisco, CA, USA 94121
about: Home to a herd of American bison since 1891. This surprising urban wildlife enclosure lets you see these majestic creatures grazing in a meadow, a living connection to the American West.
notesFromOthers: Can't believe there are actual buffalo in SF!
Best viewing in the morning when they're active
Bring binoculars - they sometimes graze far back

name: Fort Mason Community Garden
address:
2 Marina Blvd
San Francisco, CA, USA 94123
about: A beautiful community garden overlooking the bay at Fort Mason Center. This terraced garden offers stunning waterfront views and is maintained by dedicated local gardeners growing vegetables, flowers, and herbs.
notesFromOthers: The bay views from here are incredible!
Such a peaceful spot in the city
Love seeing what everyone is growing

name: Bernal Heights Community Garden
address:
Folsom St & Ellsworth St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94110
about: A vibrant neighborhood garden in Bernal Heights featuring organic plots, fruit trees, and a welcoming community of gardeners. The garden serves as a green oasis and gathering place for local residents.
notesFromOthers: The neighborhood vibe here is amazing
Great place to learn about urban gardening
The fruit trees are so productive!

name: Garden for the Environment
address:
7th Ave & Lawton St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94122
about: An educational demonstration garden in the Inner Sunset that teaches sustainable gardening practices. Features native plants, composting systems, and workshops on organic gardening and environmental stewardship.
notesFromOthers: The workshops here are fantastic!
So many great ideas for sustainable gardening
Kids love the educational programs

name: Clipper Terrace Community Garden
address:
Clipper St & Douglass St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94114
about: A hillside community garden with terraced plots offering panoramic city views. This well-maintained garden is known for its colorful flowers, diverse vegetables, and strong sense of community among gardeners.
notesFromOthers: The city views while gardening are unbeatable
Really friendly community of gardeners
Love the terraced layout on the hillside

name: Potrero Hill Community Garden
address:
Utah St & 20th St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94107
about: One of the oldest community gardens in San Francisco, established in the 1970s. This sunny Potrero Hill garden features abundant vegetable plots, fruit trees, and a strong community dedicated to organic urban agriculture.
notesFromOthers: Historic garden with so much character
The sunny microclimate is perfect for growing
Community events here are wonderful

name: Alemany Farm
address:
700 Alemany Blvd
San Francisco, CA, USA 94110
about: San Francisco's largest urban farm, spanning 3.5 acres with stunning city views. This nonprofit farm grows organic produce for the community and hosts educational programs, volunteer days, and farm-to-table events.
notesFromOthers: Amazing that this exists in the city!
The volunteer days are so rewarding
Best views of SF from a farm

name: Howard Langton Community Garden
address:
Howard St & Langton St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94103
about: A hidden gem tucked in SoMa, this small but thriving community garden offers a green respite in the urban landscape. Known for its creative use of vertical space and container gardening in a dense city environment.
notesFromOthers: A secret garden in the heart of SoMa!
Impressive what they grow in such a small space
Great inspiration for small-space gardening
